subject: Management
title: Building Your Succession
description: A 60-second lesson on Building Your Succession.

hook.text: A director got promoted but couldn't leave her old roleâ€”nobody could replace her.

buildup.text: If you're irreplaceable, you're also unpromotable. Your growth depends on growing others.

discovery.text: Systematic delegation builds successors naturally, one capability at a time.

twist.text: The manager who hordes knowledge to feel secure actually traps themselves.

climax.text: Build two people who can do 80% of your job. That's your ticket to the next level.

punchline.text: Your next promotion depends on your replacement.

quiz.question: Why does hoarding work prevent career advancement?
options: No one can replace you so you can't move up
It shows you're the most valuable person
It ensures the highest quality output
